title: Caught Stealing
description: A young miner has been caught stealing food and alcohol. Times are tough, but theft and selfishness threatens the survival of all. How should we handle this?

options.text: Beck - He’s just a kid. We discipline him, but everyone deserves a second chance.
options.outcome: The miner is given a stern warning and has their rations reduced for a week. Some see this as fair, while many call it soft.

options.text: Old-Timer - Theft can’t go unpunished. Hard labor will teach him—and others—not to try it again.
options.outcome: The miner is forced into exhausting work as punishment. It's brutal, but the settlement remains orderly.

options.text: Shady - Hard labor? Aren't we ALL doing hard labor? Stealing means exile. If we don’t make an example of him, we invite chaos.
options.outcome: The miner is exiled. Theft is no longer a concern, but the settlement is left shaken.
